title: IM360: Textured Mesh Reconstruction for Large-scale Indoor Mapping with 360° Cameras
author: Dongki Jung (University of Maryland), Jaehoon Choi (University of Maryland), Yonghan Lee (University of Maryland), Dinesh Manocha (University of Maryland), ...
relevance_why: The paper presents a novel approach for 3D reconstruction using omnidirectional cameras, which could inform techniques for audio-visual integration in immersive environments, a potential interest in Haohe's research.
background: The task focuses on reconstructing 3D indoor environments and textures from images captured with omnidirectional cameras, addressing challenges of sparse scene data and textureless regions.
contribution: This paper introduces a complete 3D reconstruction pipeline for omnidirectional cameras to solve issues associated with traditional methods, achieving superior reconstruction quality in large-scale indoor settings.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods focus on conventional cameras, which struggle in textureless and sparse conditions, often failing to register images accurately.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates a spherical camera model across all Structural-from-Motion components, improving feature matching and camera localization in difficult scenarios.

key_innovation: Combines classical and neural rendering techniques to refine visual textures and create accurate 3D models from sparse omnidirectional input.
real_world_impact: The approach streamlines indoor mapping processes for various applications, such as augmented reality and robotics, enhancing efficiency and effectiveness. No immediate real-world impact if used purely theoretically.
limitations: The performance relies heavily on the effectiveness of the matching pairs during image acquisition and the accuracy of the underlying mesh geometry.

new_terms.Structure-from-Motion: **Structure-from-Motion** is a photogrammetry technique used to reconstruct 3D structures from a series of 2D images.
new_terms.neural implicit surface reconstruction: **Neural implicit surface reconstruction** utilizes neural networks to represent surfaces implicitly, enabling high-quality 3D modeling from sparse point cloud data.
